messageSet.name: game loading tips
messageSet.message: experience rules work the best as an introduction to vr and to the game~ ~ levels are linear, there are no devices to use, ammo is infinite and health regenerates~ ~ there is no story, no voiceovers, no overlay info

standard rules focus on action and adventure~ ~ resource management is simplified and there are less things to learn~ ~ while the navigation is simplified (when compared to advanced rules), it is still possible to go in any direction you desire

advanced rules introduce more gameplay mechanisms~ ~ besides resource management, there are numerous devices whose purpose has to be discovered by the player~ ~ the navigation does not provide a path towards the objective - requires the use of the map

the map gives a simplified overview of the region around you~ ~ the world is divided into cells and to move from one cell to another, you have to follow the door direction displays~ ~ door direction displays show absolute directions, ie. up on the door direction display is up on the map

weapons use common energy storages~ ~ this means that they don't have their own storages but share storage in your arm~ ~ each weapon is made of interchangeable parts that affect its stats and features
your primary weapons are attached to your forearms~ ~ if you release them, they are holstered there~ ~ to replace your primary weapon, remove it from your forearm~
some weapons may be ineffective against certain targets~ ~ examples:~ ~ - discharge weapon won't penetrate shield~ ~ - non-piercing projectile won't do damage to fully armoured target
not all entities you meet are hostile~ ~ some may even be turned to your side~ ~ try picking them up, examine them,~ look for buttons, levers and handles~
some robots don't have visual or audio sensors~ ~ they don't see you, neither they hear you~
the primary source for energy are wall-mounted dispensers~ ~ you can get access to extra energy via upgrades or inside some of the robots
